data.title: Sigourney Weaver: 'Hollywood is like Ancient Egypt - it's all about power'
data.meta_description: SIGOURNEY WEAVER has starred in some iconic films  and Exodus: Gods and Kings is her most epic yet. Elaine Lipworth finds out how the actress has stayed at the top of her game for four decades.
data.text:
From Alien to Avatar, SIGOURNEY WEAVER has starred in some of cinemas most iconic films  and her new blockbusterExodus: Gods and Kings is her most epic yet. Elaine Lipworth finds out how the 65-year-old actress has stayed at the top of her game for almost four decades

Sigourney Weaver is singing the praises of Bill Nighy. I think he is adorable, says the actress. I read an interview with him in which he said, Im working on living each day without anticipation of tomorrow and without regret for yesterday and I thought that was wonderful and exciting.

Over macaroons and tea at a caf in New York, Sigourney and I are discussing the nature of happiness and her admiration for the British actors philosophical approach to life. Sigourney the star of blockbusters ranging from Alien to Avatar  is also focusing on living in the moment. She celebrated her 65th birthday in October and has an unusually positive perspective on getting older: I say bring it on. What other choice do you have? Pretend its not happening? I do not feel 65 and I dont miss being 20. There are a lot of benefits to being older, so many things to enjoy about life: my garden, each beautiful sunrise.

Almost six feet tall, Sigourney is an imposing presence. She looks terrific in black Comme des Garons trousers and a Dries Van Noten top. Her reddish hair is cut in a neck-length bob and there are lines around her sparkling brown eyes, though she doesnt judge those who do have plastic surgery.

I don't want someone to laser my face. I'm afraid of having anything done

Whatever is good for your morale, do it, says the actress, who is married to theatre and film director Jim Simpson; they have one child, Charlotte, 24. My tip is to wash your face before you go to bed and put on moisturiser. I try to beat that into my daughter. I have been in the sun and I havent been as good as I could have been with my skin, but I dont want someone to laser my face. Im always afraid of having anything done.

Sigourney is a New Yorker. She grew up in the city with her brother Trajan, her English actress mother Elizabeth Inglis and her father, TV executive Pat Weaver, who was president of the US TV network NBC. Starting out in the theatre, Sigourneys first major film was Ridley Scotts Alien in 1979. A Hollywood trailblazer, as Ellen Ripley she became the first female action star, soaring on to the A-list. With a slew of hit films including Ghostbusters, she has received three Oscar nominations for James Camerons Aliens, Gorillas in the Mist and Working Girl  the latter two both in the same year (1989).

She last worked with Ridley Scott on 1492: Conquest of Paradise and is reunited with the British director again for the Biblical epic Exodus: Gods and Kings, starring Christian Bale as Moses. Joel Edgerton plays the Pharaoh Ramses and Sigourney plays his mother, the calculating Queen Tuya.

An enthusiastic Anglophile (I feel completely at home in England), the actress is currently in Manchester where she is filming new movie A Monster Calls  based on the childrens book by Patrick Ness  with Liam Neeson and Felicity Jones. Next year she will be in Los Angeles to film three Avatar sequels with James Cameron.

Sigourneys co-stars have included some of Hollywoods most talented leading men: Harrison Ford, Bill Murray and Sam Worthington. So far she hasnt worked with Bill Nighy. Id love to work with him! Put that as the title of this article. I want to be in the present, without fearing the future or regretting the pastwith Bill!

Here the actress opens up about marriage, motherhood, gardening and the Beatles

I had a privileged upbringing but I wasnt spoiled. I got to grow up in New York City and travel all over the world with my parents. We had a little apartment in France. There was no kitchen and no bathroom, we slept on camp beds  it was fun. My parents were very close. My father was mercurial, charming and funny. My mother was strict and very disciplined. I dont know that I knew her as well as I might have liked, I think English people are a bit hard to get to know I dont know if thats a terrible generalisation but theyre private: Pull your socks up and get on with it!

My mother was a great role model. She was very athletic; she played tennis and golf and could have done anything. She could have climbed Mount Everest if shed set her mind to it. I think she sacrificed her career for her family. My father was so successful and busy, and in those days the women were the power behind the men.

I saw the Beatles at the Hollywood Bowl in LA 50 years ago. I had just moved to California so I didnt know anyone and I went to the concert by myself. I was surrounded by girls hysterically screaming Paul and George. I love the Beatles but I was not crying. The best part was walking home with a girl I had just met. A limo came around the corner towards us and it was the Beatles. They waved and slowed down; they were so close to us. It was incredible. I remember lying down for 48 hours just going over it in my mind.

John was my favourite Beatle. I liked him for the most terrible reason. He used to make sandwiches for the VIP lounge at an airport and he once said he would put his shoe in the bread after he made them. I thought, Oh my God, hes such a revolutionary. Now I think that is disgusting, but at the time I thought he was a hero, because we were all about the generation gap.

Ive made a lot of movies, but this one, Exodus, was the first time I went, Wow, Im really in an epic. Everyone knows the story. It is about the exodus of the Jews from Egypt with the plagues and the Red Sea, so it was a perfect canvas for Ridley to go to town on. I loved his historical films Gladiator and Kingdom of Heaven. This is such a juicy script and the set at Pinewood Studios was like being in another world. There were cheetahs, cobras, eagles and gods made of Styrofoam.

Ridley is like a kid. He hasnt changed over the years and its such a pleasure to work with him again. He is filled with excitement about what hes doing and its great to see him in action again at the age of who-knows-what. Hes working with six cameras, extras, chariots and God knows what else. Hes such a pro. Were very fond of each other and I think hes a lovely, dear man.

Christian Bale is charming and funny. He made jokes about the wigs they tried to put on him. He could have been a lot of different Moseses, lets just put it that way. In the end he didnt wear a wig. Christian is fearless and incredibly versatile. Hes very serious but he doesnt take himself seriously. Joel [Edgerton] is an amazing, complex actor and a sweetheart. Before the shoot he gave all of us little Egyptian stamps as gifts.

Tuya is a tough cookie. Unlike some of the famous queens before her, she did not have a lot of power and that was a pretty difficult environment for her. Her whole focus is on her son Ramses. She is trying to make sure he can survive all the threats he is facing, including the popularity of Moses, which is undeniable. She is fascinating and I was able to go to the British Museum and do a little research on her.

Tuya is the queen of Egypt and her own son wont even listen to her. I often play people who arent listened to! I am not listened to in my next film A Monster Calls either. Your children dont listen to you.

Hollywood is not unlike Ancient Egypt  a world which is all about power and how to navigate it. You are always asking yourself: How am I doing? Similarly, every day Tuya has to take the temperature of the court and make sure the pharaoh wants her son to be in power, so its about constantly keeping lots of plates in the air. I dont live in Hollywood but I can imagine that years ago in the studio system, someone had to choose between Joan Crawford and Bette Davis, which star to put in the new movie thats going to be a runaway hit. And it was probably like the pharaoh having many queens! Everyone was wondering: Which queen is he going to take?

Ridley wanted me to look like a million bucks with lots of gold and snake armbands. The costume designer Janty Yates is wonderful and the costumes were exquisite, handmade in Italy. I had a pheasant headdress, a peacock headdress and a headdress made from real scarab beetles.

I dont think you can love science and love studying the universe and not believe in God. But I dont believe theres an old man with a beard sitting up there. I hope its a beautiful woman! I am not a regular churchgoer but I certainly think that there is a spark of something higher in each of us and that its not a bad idea to try to connect with that spark.

I play a grandmother who is not very grandmotherly in my next film A Monster Calls. It is about a boy whose mother has cancer. He has dreams in which he summons a yew tree monster who takes him on amazing journeys. Liam Neeson is playing the monster and Felicity Jones plays the boys mother.

I like to live in the moment. I walked by a young guy who was on his phone the other day; he was with his kids. I was looking at the sky, which was getting really stormy. It was twilight and it was such an exciting sky. But the father had forgotten to look up because he was so busy with his kids. Maybe you have to be older to realise how fast life goes by.

I hope Hillary Clinton becomes Americas next president. Oh, please, yes, finally! I think shes incredible and a great leader and we need her. Women are hopefully going to run the world one of these days and then everything will be better.

I would move to London in a second. Theres a great energy and I love to stroll in the parks. In Hyde Park you can feel that you are miles and miles away from London; you almost expect to see cows. I would love to go to the Lake District and visit Beatrix Potters house. Id be so happy living in England, but my husbands from a Scottish family and I am not sure he feels the same way about England as I do. Not that hes anti-English, so I hope that some day well be able to stay there for months at a time.

Im half-English and the other half of me is tourist with a capital T. I love British food  tea and biscuits. I went to Fortnum & Mason and found a yummy box of shortbread in a tartan tin with a big stag on it for a friend [in New York] because shes British. She had me over for tea and I got to eat some of those delicious biscuits.

The most interesting thing Ive ever done is to have a family. I became a mother quite late  I guess I was focused on my career and didnt think about it much. Then you meet the right person and its like, Oh, we should have a family. I did have to spend a lot of time away from home working. I missed some stuff when my daughter was growing up and Ill never get it back. I think its a very difficult thing to balance work and being a mother. I only have one child and the years go by very quickly. When my daughter went away to college it was hard, but I dont sit around thinking about it. It is so exciting that she is off in the world. Thats what theyre supposed to be doing. Were really close and I feel so lucky.

My daughter has no interest whatsoever in acting  which I think is great. Its a tough business. I dont know how I made it, I really dont. There are people as talented as I am who are still unknown. My daughter is a writer. She has written a childrens book and a couple of radio plays and is also working in a divine jewellery store in New York. I think its great to be young and doing different things.

I hope I get to have grandchildren while I can still function. I dont want to be 90! But these kids today are so busy living their lives and I cant even imagine my daughter settling down.

My husband and I have just celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary. We were in upstate New York [at their house] for two months and I feel as though we celebrated all summer. We meant to give a big party, a square dance, because thats how we met. I gave a Halloween square dance when I started filming Ghostbusters, he came to it and thats when we started going out. So we were going to do it again, but it takes a lot of energy to organise a big party. These days couples are so busy, theres no time to spend together so it was just nice for us to loaf around and enjoy nature.

I dont know why our marriage works except that I think its because my husband was born in Hawaii and has a lot of aloha in him. I dont know how to translate that! And Im an intense New Yorker; I just think were really lucky.

We have record players in almost every room. Because of that, people give us their old records. [Someone at] a local radio station gave us 1,500 classical records that were going mouldy in his garage so were playing a lot of Purcell and Rachmaninoff and Schumann. My perfect Sunday is reading the paper and listening to music with my husband. My husband has always been a big jazz guy and now hes fallen in love with classical music. It is so different to hear it played on a record player. The sound goes into your stomach in a different way.

I cant tell you anything about Avatar except that Jim [Cameron] is doing three films simultaneously and I dont know how! One is hard enough, but if anyone can do it, he can. I have a wonderful character in all three. I think people love Avatar because its a primal story that takes you to a fascinating, wild other world and it is about themes that are timely and relevant  the destruction of the environment and oppression of native people  but its also a great love story.

We try to be together as a family at Christmas. Its always fun to get our own Christmas tree and chop it down. Its usually a straggly looking tree but if you put enough stuff on it, it looks good. I cook recipes that my mother would have cooked  roast leg of lamb and turkey and all those Englishy things.
